result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:01 PM Defendant Erin A. Van Epps in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day in court for Erin A. Van Epps.  Attorney Zachary P Leigh in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites joint recommendation: Cts 1: dismissed.  Ct 2: amend to misdemeanor Bail Jumping.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently enters into the plea agreement and joint recommendation.   Counsel stipulate to their request of jail time to run concurrent.  
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 01:15 pm.
Sentencing hearing on January 6, 2023 at 01:15 pm.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
request to reschedule plea and sentencing

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 11, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

12:59 PM Defendant Erin A. Van Epps in court.  Attorney Curtis E. Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day in court for Erin A. Van Epps.   Waiver of Preliminary Hearing - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently waives right to preliminary hearing.   Information filed.  Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant. Waiver of formal reading of the information.  Defendant stands mute - not guilty plea entered.  Parties may appear via zoom/phone for next hearing.

Curtis E Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Erin A. Van Epps appeared by video means with Attorney.  Status conference scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
